word.w2004.style
Class ParagraphPieceStyle

java.lang.Object
  word.w2004.style.AbstractStyle
      word.w2004.style.ParagraphPieceStyle
All Implemented Interfaces:
ISuperStylin
public class ParagraphPieceStyle
extends AbstractStyle
implements ISuperStylin

Author:
anyone Use this class in order to apply specifics style to paragraph. Eg.: one word in bold, other in italic.

create

public ParagraphPiece create()
This is the ParagraphPiece! I am using Covariant Return Type!!! to be honest, I have never thought how to use and finally here we go!!! It will give the chance to eliminate the necessity of type cast for elements.

textColor

public ParagraphPieceStyle textColor(java.lang.String textColor)
If you know the color code, just to straight to the point! Eg.: yellow: FFFF00, black: 000000, red: FF0000, blue: 0000FF, green: 008000, etc... If you want, you can use the class Color.whatever_color.

Parameters:
hexadecimal - color code
